Top-man chances as Hawke’s Bay takes grip on first Hawke Cup defence https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/top-man-chances-as-hawkes-bay-takes-grip-on-first-hawke-cup-defence/ZMRRGTLGLFGJ5C6YNMASTK2CAU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/top-man-chances-as-hawkes-bay-takes-grip-on-first-hawke-cup-defence/ZMRRGTLGLFGJ5C6YNMASTK2CAU/ Doug LaingCricket's Hawke Cup defence has started with much expected of two in-form players Sat, 27 Jan 2024 20:48:06 +0000 Front-line bowler Liam Dudding, opening the Hawke Cup match for Hawke’s Bay with 6-56 against Manawatu at Nelson Park, Napier, and then scoring 20 with the bat, applauds a half-century for teammate Brad Schmulian, whose hopes of a record 11th century for Hawke’s Bay on the day vanished when he was out for 60. Photo / Connull Lang

Photo / RiverLink partners
